page.title: 10COASTLINE, PEGWELL BAY
page.content: {THE CLIFFS}:The chalk cliffs at Pegwell Bay are one of its most attractive features with many small caves and inlets and a thin line of flint as well as the brown brickearth at the top of the cliffs. The Bay was made famous by the artist William Dyce {PEGWELL BAY}'A Recollection of October 5th 1858'. Charles Dickens the author knew the Bay also. Many visitors walk along the shore when the tide is out as well as along the cliff-top footpath to admire the splendid views {GEOLOGY :}Fossils such as Belemnites, Conulus, Micraster Coranguinum, the bi-valve Cordita, Raphidonema, sponge and ostracods _ micro fossils, can all be found, some in the cliffs, some on the beach. {THE THANET BEDS}Unconformity is a geological feature in Pegwell Bay and of great interest to geologists.
